spanishExample: La mujer consideró importante hacer ese viaje.
englishTranslation: The woman considered it important to make that trip.

spanishExample: El jefe me dijo que había mantenido las medidas por más tiempo.
englishTranslation: The boss told me that he had maintained the measures for more time.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
había: "had", "he/she/it had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 3rd person)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")

spanishExample: María dijo: en ese caso, nos mantuvimos tranquilos.
englishTranslation: Maria said: “In that case, we kept quiet.”

spanishExample: La chica que vino ayer dijo que no había recibido su libro.
englishTranslation: The girl who came yesterday said she had not received her book.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
había: "had", "he/she/it had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: El equipo logró hacer muchos cambios en la organización.
englishTranslation: The team managed to make many changes in the organization.

spanishExample: La comunidad nos preguntó si habíamos comenzado a trabajar en eso.
englishTranslation: The community asked us if we had begun working on that.
vocabIncluded: a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
habíamos: "had", "we had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 1st person plural)
nos: "us" as an indirect object ("to us", "for us")
preguntó: asked, he/she/it asked (Preguntar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Me dijo que la música estaba considerando su próximo concierto.
englishTranslation: He told me that the musician was considering her next concert.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")

spanishExample: La población había logrado hacer algo distinto ese año.
englishTranslation: The population had managed to do something different that year.
vocabIncluded: había: "had", "he/she/it had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: El director dijo que había mantenido el valor de las acciones.
englishTranslation: The director said he had maintained the value of the stock.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
había: "had", "he/she/it had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: La comunidad tiene la posibilidad de hacerlo el próximo año.
englishTranslation: The community has a chance to do it next year.

spanishExample: ¡No hay necesidad de comenzar a trabajar en ese objetivo ahora!
englishTranslation: There isn’t a need to start working on that goal now!
vocabIncluded: a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)

spanishExample: De hecho, hay que considerar cómo lograr esos objetivos.
englishTranslation: In fact, there is a need to consider how to achieve those goals.
vocabIncluded: cómo: adverb meaning "how?" in a question or implied question
hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)
using Haber with "que" to indicate that there's a need to do something

spanishExample: Hemos recibido la ropa hecha a medida y por eso estamos felices.
englishTranslation: We have received the tailor-made clothes and that’s why we are happy.
vocabIncluded: hemos: "have", "we have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: La organización cuyo director está aquí ha hecho muchos productos.
englishTranslation: The organization whose director is here has made many products.
vocabIncluded: ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: La comunidad puso como condición contar con más recursos.
englishTranslation: The community made it a condition to count on more resources.
vocabIncluded: puso: put, he/she/it put (Poner, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Con esos datos, el doctor dijo que eso haría efecto pronto.
englishTranslation: With that data, the doctor said that that would soon make an effect.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
haría: "would do/make", "he/she/it would do/make" (Hacer, conditional, 3rd person)

spanishExample: A medida que tengamos más experiencia, lograremos más objetivos.
englishTranslation: As we get more experience, we will achieve more goals.

spanishExample: Con esa condición, la comunidad comenzó a recibir algunos productos.
englishTranslation: With that condition, the community began to receive some products.
vocabIncluded: a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)

spanishExample: En el siglo XX, ese fondo en la imagen era así.
englishTranslation: In the 20th century, that background in the image was like this.
vocabIncluded: así: adverb meaning "this way", "that way", "like this", "like that"

spanishExample: Desde mi experiencia, aún faltan algunas cosas en la educación.
englishTranslation: From my experience, there are still some things missing in education.
vocabIncluded: faltan: lack/are missing, they lack/are missing (Faltar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Me preguntó si la población de esta comunidad tenía alguna necesidad.
englishTranslation: He asked me if the population of this community had any needs.
vocabIncluded: me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
preguntó: asked, he/she/it asked (Preguntar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: La próxima acción es que la organización reciba y mantenga un fondo.
englishTranslation: The next action is for the organization to receive and maintain a fund.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: No creo que logremos mantener ese efecto en la imagen.
englishTranslation: I don't think we will be able to maintain that effect on the image.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: La educación de este siglo nos ha dado muchas más posibilidades.
englishTranslation: The education of this century has given us many more possibilities.
vocabIncluded: ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
nos: "us" as an indirect object ("to us", "for us")

spanishExample: Hemos recibido un libro cuyos datos no teníamos.
englishTranslation: We have received a book whose data we did not have.
vocabIncluded: hemos: "have", "we have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Me preguntaron si manteníamos el objetivo o si era uno distinto.
englishTranslation: They asked me if we were maintaining the objective or if it was a different one.
vocabIncluded: me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
preguntaron: asked, they asked (Preguntar, preterite, 3rd person plural)
